keyword: how many calories are in a spoonful of sugar
title: How Many Calories in a Spoonful of Sugar?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in a spoonful of sugar (about 16 kcal per teaspoon), plus carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and common variations for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Spoonful of Sugar?
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 spoonful = 1 level teaspoon ≈4 g; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, granule size, packing density, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A spoonful (teaspoon) of granulated sugar contains about 16 calories, all from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a teaspoon of sugar?
faqs.a: About 16 kcal for 1 level teaspoon of granulated sugar.

faqs.q: Is a spoonful of sugar the same as a teaspoon?
faqs.a: Typically yes, but specify level or heaping; a tablespoon is larger at 48 kcal.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a spoonful of sugar?
faqs.a: 4 g carbs, all from sugars, with 0 g fiber or protein.

faqs.q: How does brown sugar compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar at ≈17 kcal per teaspoon due to trace molasses.

faqs.q: Does sugar type affect calories per spoonful?
faqs.a: Minimal difference; granulated, powdered, or brown are ≈16-17 kcal per teaspoon.
